title: ISic003299. Fragment of an epitaph
body:
Facsimile Images

[ἐνθάδε κῖτε ---]-
νος ζή[σας ἔτη ---]
ἀμέμπ[τως τελευτᾷ]
τῇ πρὸ ιδ´ [καλανδῶν]
5Μαρτ(ίων) ἡμέρ[ᾳ ---]

Apparatus criticus

Text based on photograph; Ferrua: [κεῖται]; Korhonen: [κῖτε]
line.5: In the lacuna, a day of the week should be mentioned

English translation

Here lies -nos, having lived for ... years blamelessly. He died 14 days before the kalends of March on the day of…

Italian translation

Qui giace -nos, avendo vissuto ... anni senza colpa. Morì 14 giorni prima delle Calende di marzo, nel giorno di …

commentary

This Christian epitaph has the traditional structure with the ἐνθάδε κεῖται formula, the name of the deceased (here in the lacuna) followed by his age and by another independent sentence with the day of death (with the present of τελευτάω), as recurring in other inscriptions from Catania, such as IG 14.556 = ISic001375. In the lacuna there should also have been the specification of the day of the week (ἡμέρ[ᾳ---]).

bibliography

  • 208 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10000028
  • Ferrua 1989 120 no.459 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001995
